summary: This document is a 1993 agricultural grazing lease (GM2791) from the New Mexico State Land Office to the Zorro Trust, with Jeffrey E. Epstein as Trustee. It includes the lease agreement, related correspondence, and a partial assignment from a previous lease, detailing the terms, rental payments, and legal formalities for land in New Mexico. This document is a collection of correspondence and official forms from the New Mexico State Land Office regarding grazing leases and an improvement application for the Zorro Ranch property, held by the Zorro Trust with Jeffrey E. Epstein as trustee. It includes a notice of unpaid rent, an application to build a grass landing strip, subsequent withdrawal of that application, and a formal agricultural lease agreement. This document is a series of official communications from the New Mexico State Land Office regarding Agricultural Lease No. GM-2791, held by the Zorro Trust with Jeffrey E. Epstein as trustee. It includes a 1994 notice of incomplete renewal paperwork, a 1999 lease expiration notice, and related filing records, showing Epstein's control of a land trust in New Mexico.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The named trustee and lessee for the Zorro Ranch property, corresponding with the New Mexico State Land Office regarding lease payments and an application to build a private grass landing strip, which he later withdrew.

persons.name: John J. Kelly
persons.context: He acts as attorney-in-fact for Jeffrey Epstein, signing lease documents on Epstein's behalf and handling correspondence with the State Land Office.

persons.context: She is the contact person at the State Land Office handling the grazing lease GM2791, receiving documents and correspondence.

persons.role: Commissioner of Public Lands, New Mexico
persons.context: He is the Commissioner of Public Lands for New Mexico, the lessor on the grazing lease, and his office approves the lease.

persons.context: He is a paralegal at the law firm representing the Zorro Trust, handling the submission of lease documents and correspondence.

persons.context: The Commissioner of Public Lands for New Mexico, whose office issued the grazing lease, correspondence, and formal lease agreement to the Zorro Trust.

persons.context: An employee in the Surface Resources Division of the N.M. State Land Office who signed a letter regarding unpaid grazing lease rent.

persons.name: Marcus Garcia
persons.context: A New Mexico State Land Office employee to whom a fax was sent from Zorro Ranch withdrawing the application for a grass landing strip.

persons.name: Shannon Pritchard
persons.context: A notary public who notarized the appraisement form for the grazing land lease.

persons.name: Ray Powell
persons.context: The Commissioner of Public Lands for the State of New Mexico, whose office is managing the agricultural lease held by the Zorro Trust.

persons.name: Fernando Roybal

persons.name: Dennis Garcia

connections.description: John J. Kelly acts as Attorney-in-Fact for Jeffrey Epstein, signing legal documents on his behalf for the Zorro Trust lease.
Epstein (as trustee for Zorro Trust) is the lessee, and Baca (as Commissioner) is the lessor in a formal grazing lease agreement with the State of New Mexico.
Kelly corresponds with Valdez at the State Land Office regarding the execution and submission of the grazing lease documents.
Wyman, as a paralegal at the law firm, handles administrative tasks for Epstein's trust regarding the lease.
Epstein is listed as the trustee for the Zorro Trust, which is the legal entity holding the grazing lease for Zorro Ranch.
Epstein, as trustee for Zorro Trust, is the lessee of state grazing land from Powell's office, the Commissioner of Public Lands.
Epstein corresponded with Garcia to withdraw an application for improvements (a grass landing strip) on the leased land.
A 'Power of Attorney' involving John J. Kelly is filed alongside an affidavit from Epstein as trustee, suggesting a legal delegation of authority related to the trust's lease.

events.title: Lease GM2791 Effective Date
events.description: The agricultural grazing lease GM2791 between the New Mexico State Land Office and the Zorro Trust (Jeffrey E. Epstein, Trustee) begins.

events.title: Partial Relinquishment Approved
events.description: The Commissioner approves a partial relinquishment of land from lease GM-2583 to create the new lease GM-2791 for Zorro Trust.

events.title: Lease Documents Submitted
events.description: The law firm Hinkle, Cox submits the signed lease, affidavits, and power of attorney to the State Land Office for approval.

events.title: Annual Rental Payment
events.description: The law firm submits the annual rental payment for lease GM2791 for the period October 1, 1993 to September 30, 1994.

events.title: Grazing Lease Rental Due
events.description: Annual rental payment for grazing lease GM-2791 was due to the New Mexico State Land Office.

events.title: Withdrawal of Landing Strip Application
events.description: Zorro Ranch (via Jeffrey Epstein) sent a letter to Marcus Garcia withdrawing the application to build a grass landing strip on the state-leased land.

events.title: State Office Recommends Withdrawal
events.description: The New Mexico State Land Office, following the lessee's request, recommended the improvement application be withdrawn.

events.title: New Grazing Lease Term Begins
events.description: A new agricultural lease (GM-2792) for Zorro Trust, with Jeffrey Epstein as trustee, commenced for a five-year term ending September 30, 1999.

events.title: Lease Renewal Incomplete Notice
events.description: The New Mexico State Land Office notifies the Zorro Trust that its lease renewal package is incomplete and requires a completed appraisement form.

events.title: Lease Expiration Notice
events.description: The State Land Office notifies the Zorro Trust that Agricultural Lease GM-2791 is due to expire on September 30, 1999, and outlines renewal procedures.

events.title: Lease Payment Processed
events.description: A receipt shows a payment by the Zorro Trust was processed for the agricultural lease.

events.title: Lease Payment Processed
events.description: A receipt shows another payment by the Zorro Trust was processed for the agricultural lease.

keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein, as trustee for the Zorro Trust, held an agricultural grazing lease (GM2791) for 1,158.97 acres of land in New Mexico from the state.
The lease was created from a partial relinquishment of a larger lease (GM-2583) and was effective from February 22, 1991, to September 30, 1994.
John J. Kelly acted as Attorney-in-Fact for Epstein, signing the lease documents and handling correspondence with the New Mexico State Land Office.
The annual rental for the grazing land was calculated using a formula based on carrying capacity and an Economic Variable Index, totaling $856.99 for the documented period.
Epstein's address of record was 457 Madison Avenue in New York City, and he requested his name be added as 'Trustee' to ensure proper delivery of notices.
Jeffrey Epstein, as trustee for the Zorro Trust, held a grazing lease (GM-2791) on New Mexico state land for Zorro Ranch.
Epstein/Zorro Trust applied for permission to build a 'grass strip runway for Private Plane' on the leased land in July 1994, valuing the improvement at $6,000.
In May 1994, Epstein withdrew the application for the private plane landing strip, and the State Land Office canceled the request.
A new five-year agricultural lease (GM-2792) was executed, commencing October 1, 1994, between the Commissioner of Public Lands and the Zorro Trust, with Epstein as trustee.
The documents show Epstein was managing the remote Zorro Ranch property in New Mexico in the mid-1990s and sought to build private aviation infrastructure there.
Jeffrey Epstein, as trustee for the 'Zorro Trust', held Agricultural Lease No. GM-2791 for grazing/agricultural land from the State of New Mexico.
The trust's address of record was Epstein's New York address at 457 Madison Ave.
Official correspondence from 1994 and 1999 shows the lease was active and required renewal, indicating a long-term financial interest in New Mexico property.
A 'Power of Attorney' for John J. Kelly and an affidavit from Epstein were filed as miscellaneous instruments related to the lease.
The documents are routine government land management records, revealing a previously known but formalized asset (land lease) controlled by Epstein through a trust.
